results.title: The Queen of Sheba
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Famous women of the past”.
Strange and dramatic pages from the lives of the world’s most famous women. The Queen of Sheba having heard of King Solomon’s wisdom, travels across the desert to Jerusalem to meet him. The journey is one of the greatest overland journeys in history. On her arrival, the King greets her with majestic splendour, cordiality and hospitality. After a six-month stay, the Queen decides to return home. Following a sumptuous banquet in her honour, King Solomon tricks the Queen and satisfies his lust for this woman of great beauty and deep intelligence. The Queen of Sheba returns home and gives birth to a son. King Soloman never sees the Queen again but does finally meet his 16 yeaer old son, who later becomes the King of Abyssinia.

results.title: Costa Rica
results.creator_credit: Rolando Quiros, Horst Cerns, UNICEF and Japanese TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Families of the world”.
Captures the flavour of life on a Costa Rican coffee plantation during harvest time when the whole family helps. At harvest’s end the family joins the village fiesta, parading by day and revelling by night.

results.title: Nelson Mandela
results.creator_credit: Richard Hughes, Mark Rowland, Carlton International, Mentorn International and Reel
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Famous lives”.
As the world’s most famous former prisoner to being his country’s leader, Mandela exemplifies a moral integrity that shines far beyond South Africa. In the revolution led by Mandela to transform a model of racial division and oppression into an open democracy, he demonstrated that he didn’t flinch from taking up arms, but his real qualities came to the fore after his time as an activist, during his 27 years in prison and in the eight years since his release, when he had to negotiate the challenge of turning a myth into a man. Narrated by Lucy Longhurst.

results.title: Turkey
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Families of the world”.
Shows Turkish village life. Girls weave or embroider, and father and mother farm. At day’s end, the family gathers for the evening meal and later to answer the call to prayer. A trip to Instanbul offers a respite from the normal daily routine.

results.title: Cleopatra and Antony
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Famous women of the past”.
Cleopatra, Queen of Egypt, friend and lover of Caesar, Roman Emperor. He is murdered, but she has a son, Caesarion. She is determined to have Caesar’s nephew, Octavian, (Emperor of Rome), removed and Caesarean in his place. To help the process she tries to befriend Mark Antony, the great Roman warrior. Antony succumbs to Cleopatra, and their relationship becomes unbreakable. Antony declares war on Rome to bring Caesarion to the throne - but after ten years of war, does not succeed, and their tragic deaths soon follow.

results.title: Cleopatra
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Famous women of the past”.
A narrated account of Cleopatra’s war against her younger brother, Ptolemy, and her later influence on Julius Caesar. The film uses paints of historical events and classical music adds dramatic effect.

results.title: Alejandro Mamani: a case study in culture and personality
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Ira R. Abrams, Holt, Rinehart and Winston and Coast Community College District
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Faces of culture”.
Alejandro Mamani is a leader in his Bolivian mountain community, but he is an old man and believes himself possessed of evil spirits. Many remedies are tried to rid him of these spirits, from traditional forms of exorcism to sleeping tablets, but all attempts fail and after making his will he eventually commits suicide. Did he go mad or did he simply make use of his culture to leave life, once he saw there was no further use for him and his affairs were in order? Narrated by David Carradine.

results.title: Family matters
results.creator_credit: Jack Smith and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Facts for Life”.
Explains the transition from life in the womb to life after birth. Shows care of premature babies and stresses the importance of mother-child contact. Discusses mental milestones of the first 18 months and comments on the mother’s feelings of being on duty for 24 hours a day.
